verses.text: Hear ye the word which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* speaketh unto you, O house of Israel :
Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Learn not the way of the heathen , and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven ; for the heathen are dismayed at them.

For the customs of the people \add are\add* vain : for \add one\add* cutteth a tree out of the forest , the work of the hands of the workman , with the axe.\f + \fr 10.3 \ft customs…: Heb. statutes, or, ordinances are vanity\f*
They deck it with silver and with gold ; they fasten it with nails and with hammers , that it move not.

They \add are\add* upright as the palm tree , but speak not: they must needs be borne , because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil , neither also \add is it\add* in them to do good.
Forasmuch as \add there is\add* none like unto thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; thou \add art\add* great , and thy name \add is\add* great in might.

Who would not fear thee, O King of nations ? for to thee doth it appertain : forasmuch as among all the wise \add men\add* of the nations , and in all their kingdoms , \add there is\add* none like unto thee.\f + \fr 10.7 \ft to…: or, it liketh thee\f*
But they are altogether brutish and foolish : the stock \add is\add* a doctrine of vanities.\f + \fr 10.8 \ft altogether: Heb. in one, or, at once\f*

Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish , and gold from Uphaz , the work of the workman , and of the hands of the founder : blue and purple \add is\add* their clothing : they \add are\add* all the work of cunning \add men\add*.

But the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* the true God , he \add is\add* the living God , and an everlasting king : at his wrath the earth shall tremble , and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.\f + \fr 10.10 \ft true…: Heb. God of truth\f*\f + \fr 10.10 \ft living God: Heb. living Gods\f*\f + \fr 10.10 \ft everlasting…: Heb. king of eternity\f*
Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth , \add even\add* they shall perish from the earth , and from under these heavens.
He hath made the earth by his power , he hath established the world by his wisdom , and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.

When he uttereth his voice , \add there is\add* a multitude of waters in the heavens , and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth ; he maketh lightnings with rain , and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.\f + \fr 10.13 \ft multitude: or, noise\f*\f + \fr 10.13 \ft with: or, for\f*

Every man is brutish in \add his\add* knowledge : every founder is confounded by the graven image : for his molten image \add is\add* falsehood , and \add there is\add* no breath in them.\f + \fr 10.14 \ft brutish in his knowledge: or, more brutish than to know\f*
They \add are\add* vanity , \add and\add* the work of errors : in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

The portion of Jacob \add is\add* not like them: for he \add is\add* the former of all \add things;\add* and Israel \add is\add* the rod of his inheritance : The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts \add is\add* his name. \p
¶ Gather up thy wares out of the land , O inhabitant of the fortress.\f + \fr 10.17 \ft inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress\f*
For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once , and will distress them, that they may find \add it so\add*. \p
¶ Woe is me for my hurt ! my wound is grievous : but I said , Truly this \add is\add* a grief , and I must bear it.

My tabernacle is spoiled , and all my cords are broken : my children are gone forth of me, and they \add are\add* not: \add there is\add* none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
For the pastors are become brutish , and have not sought the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: therefore they shall not prosper , and all their flocks shall be scattered.
Behold, the noise of the bruit is come , and a great commotion out of the north country , to make the cities of Judah desolate , \add and\add* a den of dragons. \p
¶ O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I know that the way of man \add is\add* not in himself: \add it is\add* not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, correct me, but with judgment ; not in thine anger , lest thou bring me to nothing.\f + \fr 10.24 \ft bring…: Heb. diminish me\f*

Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name : for they have eaten up Jacob , and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
